Description: Slimestone term. Refers to a flying machine that clears out fluid within an area.
Description (Chinese): 绿萌术语。指一种清除区域内液体的飞行器。

Description: Cannon term. Usually refers to a place where you align TNT or other propellant so that it can explode and apply motion to something else.
Description (Chinese): 大炮术语。通常指一个用于放置TNT或其他推进剂的装置，使其爆炸并推动其他物体。

Description: Usually refers to a redstone signal that is shorter than 1gt. Also used to describe a piston extending and retracting within the same game tick.
Description (Chinese): 常指短于1游戏刻的红石信号。也可用于描述在同一游戏刻内活塞的伸出和缩回。

Full Form (English): 1-Wide Trench World Eater (aka Trench-less World Eater)
Description: Slimestone term. Usually refers to world eaters that only require 1 wide main trenches on both sides.
Description (Chinese): 绿萌术语。通常指仅需两侧各1格宽主沟渠的世界吞噬者。

Description: Slimestone term. Refers to small TNT dupers with movable stations that move in 3 directions to clear an area
Description (Chinese): 绿萌术语，指可在三个方向移动的小型TNT复制机，用于清除区域

Description: Refers to a contraption that aligns items in all three axes before sending them down a stream, where they usually get picked up by hoppers. Since these contraptions are usually ran at Hopper speed, the items need to have a perfect timing between them, so that they don't reach a hopper during its cooldown stage, hence why these are also called 4D aligners (3D+time).
Description (Chinese): 指一种装置，在将物品送入水流前沿三个轴（X、Y、Z）对其进行对齐，通常由漏斗收集。由于这些装置通常以漏斗速度运行，物品之间需要精确的时间间隔，以避免在漏斗冷却期间到达，因此也被称为4D对齐器（3D空间+时间）。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to Box Loaders where you can access the box it's loading
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种打包机，允许玩家访问正在装载的潜影盒。

Chinese: （实体）对正装置/矫正装置/矫正器/校准器
Description (Chinese): 用于将实体在空间中对齐的装置
与门。一种逻辑电路，输出仅在所有输入均为真时为真。

Description: Slimestone term. Usually refers to the AND-gate in flying machines.
Description (Chinese): 绿萌术语。通常指飞行器中的与门，用于控制多个输入信号的逻辑组合
阵列。指一组按特定模式排列的样式。
轴对齐边界框，一种常用于 计算机图形学 和 碰撞检测 中的简单边界框。 它们的特点是其边缘与坐标轴平行。（常指实体或方块的碰撞箱，用于检测碰撞和交互。）
Spanish: Bounding Box Alineada en los Ejes

Description: Refers to a blast chamber component that shields item entities from explosion damage by enclosing the TNT entity into a moving block.
Description (Chinese): 指爆炸室中的一种组件，通过将TNT实体封闭在移动方块中，保护物品实体免受爆炸伤害。

Description: A fancy oak generated with the smallest size possible. It consists of a tall trunk and leaves that form a spherical shape, similar to a balloon. However, it is also sometimes being referred as the fancy oak itself.
Description (Chinese): 气球橡树。指一种最小尺寸的华丽橡树，拥有高大的树干和呈球形的树叶，形似气球而得名。有时也直接指代华丽橡树。
指通过与猪灵交易获取资源的自动化农场。
产出玄武岩的刷石机。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that groups item entities together before periodically releasing them into a waterstream or iceline.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，将物品实体聚集成组，然后定期释放到水流或冰道

Chinese: 破基岩/破基岩机/基岩机
Description (Chinese): 用于破坏基岩的装置。

Description: Usually used to describe wither cages without bedrock.
Description (Chinese): 通常用于描述不含基岩的凋灵笼。

Description: An encoding where each digit of a code is either on or off (we say it has a binary state, usually represented with 0s and 1s).
Description (Chinese): 一种编码方式，其中代码的每个位要么是开要么是关（通常表示为0或1）。
生物群系。指游戏中具有特定环境和生态特征的区域。

Description: Short for binary digit: the digits in a binary system.
Description (Chinese): 二进制系统中的单个数字，简称二进制位。

Description: Storage tech term.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。
使用爆炸摧毁方块的舱室
移动中的活塞。
指具有外观渲染，特殊功能或存储NBT数据的方块，如箱子、熔炉等。
用于同步并指导客户端执行特定方块行为或者模拟服务器发生的方块行为。

Description: Usually refers to piston updating other pistons in a chain reaction within a single game tick. Since pistons activate during the block event phase of the tick (kind of) and things execute in the order they are scheduled, having something be activated by a piston that was updated by a chain of three other pistons before it (BED 3) will always happen before something that was activated by a BED 5 event.
Chinese: 方块事件深度/方块事件延迟
Description (Chinese): 方块事件延迟/深度。通常指在单个游戏刻内，活塞通过链式反应更新其他活塞。由于活塞在游戏刻的方块事件阶段激活，且按调度顺序执行，由三个活塞链更新触发的活塞（BED 3）总比由五个活塞链更新触发的（BED 5）先发生。
指游戏中为特定方块安排的延迟执行任务。

Description: A device that has something happen when it receives an update.
Description (Chinese): 方块更新检测器。一种在接收到（NC）更新时触发特定动作的装置。

Description: Storage tech term.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指用于限制物品行径或占位的物品。

Description: Storage tech term.
Chinese: 无填充物的, 无占位物的
Description (Chinese): 无需填充物/占位物的组件*
船吸。指使用船捕获实体以处理的行为。

Description: Refers to a mob killing method by capturing the mobs with boats to remove from mob cap and killing afterwards.
Description (Chinese): 指通过用船捕获生物以移除其对生物上限的占用，随后进行击杀的掠夺方法。

Description: Slimestone term. Refers to small TNT dupers with movable stations to clear an area.
Description (Chinese): 绿萌术语。指用于清理区域的，小型的移动的TNT复制机。
植物催熟
指结合船吸跨维度传输实体以进行处理的行为。

Full Form (English): Bounding Box (aka Axis Aligned Bounding Box)
Description (Chinese): 轴对齐边界框。指实体或方块的碰撞箱。
Spanish: Bounding Box Alineada en los Ejes

Description: Storage tech term. Separates boxes based on if the first item of the input box matches an item set.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指根据输入潜影盒的第一个物品是否匹配特定物品集来分离潜影盒的装置。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes two boxes as input, and compares them by signal strength. A Box comparer normally has dedicated outputs for the fuller and less full boxes.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，接受两个潜影盒作为输入，通过信号强度比较其填充程度，通常有专用输出用于满载和较少装载的潜影盒。

Description: Storage tech term. Usually used as a way to tag Loaders and Box Displays that restart themselves when boxes come in and they were previously empty.
Chinese: 盒子输入检测/盒子扫描器
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。通常用于标记在潜影盒输入且之前为空时自动重启的打包机或潜影盒展示装置。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that displays a shulker box and has some or all of the following features: a button to dispense a new box, breaking of the box when it empties, automatically dispensing a new box when the old one is broken, storage for new shulker boxes, access to said storage, and some others, like hopper locking and not hiding boxes from the player in inaccessible inventories (called no buffer).
Chinese: 盒子展示/箱盒展示/盒展
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。一种展示潜影盒

Description: Storage tech term.
Storage tech term. A contraption that fills a shulkerbox with items and then breaks the shulkerbox.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，将物品装入潜影盒并随后破坏潜影盒以输出。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes 2 boxes as input, and merges them into one. Mergers can work of mixed boxes, however most mergers assume that both boxes only contain one itemtype and are often used in conjunction with Splitters.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，接受两个潜影盒作为输入，并将它们合并成一个。合并器可处理混合潜影盒，但大多数合并器假设两个潜影盒仅含单一物品类型，常与分盒器配合使用。

Description: Storage tech term.

Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes boxes as input and separates them into different outputs based on their contents. This could for example be a contraption that takes single item-type boxes and has different outputs for boxes with 16-stackables and 64-stackables
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，接受潜影盒作为输入，并根据其内容将其分离到不同输出。例如，可将单一物品类型的潜影盒分为16可堆叠和64可堆叠的输出。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes in boxes of a single item-type, takes the first item out and assigns the box to a storage Slice that matches the filter of that item.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，接受单一物品类型的潜影盒，取出第一个物品，并将潜影盒分配到与该物品过滤器匹配的存储单片。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes a Mixed Box as input and unloads the box into one box per item type.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，接受混合潜影盒作为输入，并将其内容卸载为每种物品类型一个潜影盒。

Description: Storage tech term. A contraption that removes item contents from a shulkerbox.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，从潜影盒中移出物品内容。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to destroying a shulker box to unload the items inside.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指通过烧毁潜影盒来卸载其内部物品的行为。
一种搜索算法，从起始节点开始，逐层扩展，先访问离起始节点最近的节点，后访问离起始节点稍远的节点。以此类推，直到完成整个搜索过程。

Description: A contraption that breeds mobs.
Description (Chinese): 繁殖生物的装置。
自动建造桥梁以跨越地形的装置。
使用BUD特性快速传递方块更新/信号的装置。

Description: Storage tech term.
Storage tech term. At it's simplest, a bulk storage is just a system that stores a lot of items, usually a single type per module and in box form.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种存储大量物品的系统，通常每个模块存储单一类型的物品，并以潜影盒形式存储。
自动化复制地毯的装置。

Chinese: 矿车盒子拆包机/矿车盒子卸货机
Description (Chinese): 使用漏斗矿车从潜影盒中卸载物品的装置。

Description: Refers to destroying a minecart to unload the items inside.
Description (Chinese): 通过烧毁矿车来卸载其内部物品的行为。

Description: Slimestone term.

Description (Chinese): 元胞自动机。指基于简单规则模拟复杂行为的系统。*

Description: Specifically for slices
Description (Chinese): 全物品中位于同一截面片的，多个独立分类/存储系统组成的单片。
指游戏世界中16x16x<世界高度>的区域，用于管理地形和实体加载。
指用于保持区块加载以维持装置运行的装置。
一连串区块加载器。
一个区块被分为数个16x16x16的子区块
区块处理，如随机刻等。
用于控制区块加载的机制。
自动产出石头的装置。

Description: Usually refers to a component that collects the item drops.
Description (Chinese): 自动集中掉落物的装置。

Description: A contraption or feature of a gravity block duper that can swap out the duped gravity blocks.
Description (Chinese): 在重力方块复制机中切换复制目标的功能。

Full Form (English): Comparator Update Detector (aka Tile Entity Update Detector)
Description: Refers to a comparator that will change its signal once it either receives a block or inventory update. It is based on the behavior inherent to comparators where they don't notice inventory changes when reading it through a solid block (including an inventory being moved away or put in place, like a composter being moved by a piston). The CUD will then change it's signal once it either receives a block or inventory update.
Description (Chinese): 检测比较器更新。
Spanish: Detector de Updates de Tile Entities (Detector de Updates de Comparadores)

Description (Chinese): 将混凝土粉末转换为混凝土的装置。

Description: Refers to a contraption that converts concrete powder duped from a gravity block duper to concrete and destroys the concrete.
Description (Chinese): 将混凝土粉末转换为混凝土的装置，但特别为刷沙机设计。
Java 中的一个运行时异常，通常在对集合进行迭代的过程中修改了集合结构时（例如，增删元素）抛出

Description: Usually refers to a contraption that conveys a block or entity.
Description (Chinese): 传世方块或实体的装置。

Description: Refers to the nether portal setup where entities passing through ends up in lazy chunk.
Description (Chinese): 一种让通过的实体出现在弱加载区块的特殊地狱门放置。

Description: Tree farming term. Refers to a type of bottom log processing for big spruce tree farms by removing the corner log first in gt0 to allow sapling planting at that spot.
Description (Chinese): 树场术语。指一种用于大型云杉树场的底部原木处理方式，通过在第0游戏刻（gt0）优先移除角落原木，以便在该位置种植树苗。

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to Box loaders with crafters in it.
Description (Chinese): 带有合成器的打包机
用于方便大量合成物品的设施。

Description: Tree farming term. Asynchronous application of bone meal to a sapling with multiple dispensers, usually used to differentiate from synced bone meal
Description (Chinese): 树场群体的术语。指多个发射器对树苗不同步地使用骨粉，一般用于和同步催熟做出区分

Description: A term used for when 2 tiled Slices are interfering with each other in any situation.
Description (Chinese): 指两个单片/线路的互相影响。

Full Form (English): Data Update Detector (aka Comparator Update Detector)
Description: Refers to a comparator that will change its signal once it either receives a block or inventory update. It is based on the behavior inherent to comparators where they don't notice inventory changes when reading it through a solid block (including an inventory being moved away or put in place, like a composter being moved by a piston). The CUD will then change it's signal once it either receives a block or inventory update.
Description (Chinese): 指一种比较器，当接收到方块或库存更新时会改变其信号。这种机制基于比较器的固有行为，即通过固体方块读取时无法察觉库存变化（包括库存被移走或放置，例如堆肥桶被活塞移动）。比较器更新检测器（CUD）在接收到方块或库存更新时会改变其信号。
Spanish: Detector de Updates de Dato (Detector de Updates de Comparadores)

Description (Chinese): 一起数到十。

Description: In computational redstone, it's sometimes used to mean increasing the size of a base, bin to hex, for example, see Transcoder.
Description (Chinese): 在计算红石中，有时指增大编码基数，例如从二进制（bin）转换为十六进制（hex），参见转码器（Transcoder）。

Description: A storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that translates code or data to item, like an encoded storage hall, the inverse of an Encoder, or one that translates code into user-readable information, like a display.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指一种装置，将代码或数据转换为物品，例如编码存储大厅，与编码器（Encoder）相反，或将代码转换为用户可读的信息，例如展示装置。
一种用于遍历或搜索的算法，其尽可能深入地访问每个节点，直到无法继续为止，然后回溯到之前的节点层继续遍历。

Description: In storage tech, it refers to components used to convert Serial codes into Parallel codes or viceversa. These sometimes also act as Encoders or Decoders, in the computational redstone sense. For example serial hex to parallel binary is a deserializer encoder.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。指用于将串行码转换为并行码或反之的组件。在计算红石意义上，这些组件有时也充当编码器或解码器。例如，从串行十六进制到并行二进制的转换属于解串器编码器。

Description: A contraption is said to be directional if it exhibits a different behavior when rotated or mirrored. This is usually caused by some internal component being directional itself, which in turn is most often caused by update order: each components notifies its neighbors of the update in a set order (for example, negative to positive z first, then negative to positive y, then x). There are also other causes of directionality.
Description (Chinese): 如果一个装置在旋转或镜像时表现出不同的行为，则称其为方向性的。这通常是由于某些内部组件本身具有方向性，而方向性最常见的原因是更新顺序：每个组件按固定顺序（例如，先从负Z到正Z，再从负Y到正Y，然后是X）通知其邻居进行更新。此外，也存在其他导致方向性的原因。
使用高度箭瞬间杀死末影龙的装置。

Description: A line of droppers to transport items fast.
Description (Chinese): 用投掷器快速传输物品的装置。

Description: Storage tech term. Similar to Hopper speed, but less frequently used. Refers to the speed at which items are processed in a dropper when clocked at the minimum interval (1 item every 4gt). Usually written as an integer or fraction (e.g. "3x or 1/2x dropper speed"). 1x Dropper speed is equal to 2x Hopper speed.
Description (Chinese): 储电术语。与漏斗速度类似，但使用较少。指投掷器在最小间隔（每4游戏刻处理1个物品）时处理物品的速度。通常以整数或分数表示（例如“3倍或1/2倍投掷器速度”）。1倍投掷器速度等于2倍漏斗速度。

Description: Some contraptions are not Dustless, but the dust they use does not get updated (does not change ss). This can be because it is either used to steadily power a component, or because it's used by redirecting it, but not changing ss. Redirecting dust is really lag friendly, as lag usage goes. These terms are therefore often used interchangeably.
Chinese: 无红石粉能量变化;无粉(广义)
Description (Chinese): 一些装置不是无粉的，但其中的粉不会发出方块更新和改变信号值。
Spanish: Sin actualizaciones de polvo de redstone

Description: Usually refers to dust update-less contraption, but it can also be used to state the absence of redstone dust within a contraption.
Description (Chinese): 通常指无红石粉更新的装置，但也可用于表示装置内完全不含红石粉。

Description: Usually refers to how efficient a contraption is utilised, like the area efficiency of an ice farm.
Usually refers to the ratio of item collected with to the actual produced item. As an example for blast chambers, it can be written as 99.6% efficiency.

Spanish: Cañón de Elytras (o Cañón de Player)

Description: Storage tech term. A system is said to be encoded when a signal in the form of a code is used to decide the fate of items or boxes. In broader terms, it refers to systems that use codes to transfer instructions. Codes can be a Binary signal, a Hexadecimal signal or, less often, octal or quaternary, with either multiple or single digits.
In computational redstone, this sometimes refers to decreasing the size of the base used in the code: for example hex to bin. see Transcoder.

Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that translates items into a code, where code can be any sort of signal in any base (bin, hex, other less used ones) or other codes (block event delay), or a contraption that translates a player input (say a selection panel) into code.
As an adjective
Machines for the production of resources in particular
Usually refers to pearl cannon where the pearl transports faster than the speed of light.

Storage tech term. Refers to a Box Separator that has different outputs based on how full the box is, usually Empty / Full / Partial. IsEmpty is a Fill Sorter that only has outputs for empty and not-empty ( Full / Partial ) IsFull is a Fill Sorter that only has outputs for full and not-full ( Empty / Partial )
Storage tech term. A Loader combined with an item filter that fills a box with just one item type.
Storage tech term, refers to a feature of a contraption (usually box unloader or box display) that automatically places the first box.
Storage tech term. Short for fixed type item sorter: a sorter that filters out one single item type and can't be changed without manual intervention.

Spanish: Alineamiento “float” (el tipo de dato en programación)

Description: Slimestone term.
A double piston extender that pushes another sticky piston in from the side, usually used in 0-tick redstone contraptions to move blocks over two blocks as fast as possible.

Chinese: 要塞全怪塔/堡垒全怪塔
Spanish: Granja general de mobs de fortaleza
Mapa de Ruido de Densidad Fraccional

Description: A measure of how many frames a client is able to process each second. This is similar to, but independent of TPS, which denotes server-side performance.
A stack of items up to 64 or 16 items depending on item type
Storage tech term. Box Loader tht loads boxes without pausing during box replacement.

Minecraft iteratively runs its processing code in a loop. One cycle of this loop is called a Tick or Gametick (gt). Gameticks are also used as the default measurement of time while working with redstone. The game attempts to run 20 gameticks a second (20tps), but will fail to do so and slow down the game if the server is lagging (>50mspt).
Storage tech term. Annotates that a signal comes from a global system ( a "brain" ), not from within a Slice. For example, one global clock could send signals to 8 slices on an interval.
Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption, usually a 1-wide tileable one, that has only one output for all the Slices, in contrast to one output per slice.
A status effect granted to the player upon defeating a raid.

A code where each digit of the code has 16 possible states (usually represented as 0 to 9 and then A to F). It's most commonly implemented with signal strength values, where ss 0 represents 0, ss10 represents A, ss15 represents F and so on. Multiple hex signals can be combined to form a code with multiple digits. For example, valid three digit hex codes are 032, AFF, 0F4.

Spanish: Alineamiento de entidades de alta precisión

Full Form (English): High Signal Strength (aka Overstacked Signal Strength)
Description: Storage tech term.
Honey and slime blocks
Spanish: Honey Slime (Bloque de miel y Slime)

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to the speed at which items are processed in a hopper (1 item every 8gt). Often used as a way of quantifying speed of a system in terms of how many hoppers worth of items are processed in or out. Usually written as an integer or fraction (e.g. "3x or 1/2x hopper speed").
Storage tech term. Used to tag contraptions that lock their hoppers when the hoppers are not needed. This is because hoppers are otherwise very laggy.

Chinese: 敌对生物伪和平/伪和平

Description: Refers to Box loader that puts loose items into a chest until the chest fills up, then starts filling shulker boxes with the items.

Raid farming term. Refers to a 1.21.5+ bug, where the Bad Omen effect remains after transforming into Raid Omen, and triggering the Raid Omen effect for free every 30 seconds within the 100-minute duration of the Bad Omen effect.
Description (Chinese): 袭击术语。指一个1.21.5的漏洞，即在不祥之兆转化为袭击之兆后并没有消失，在效果持续的 100 分钟内，每 30 秒即可免费制造一次袭击之兆。

Description: Refers to a contraption or wiring that can send signal instantly

Storage tech term. Refers to a device, mechanism or feature that allows the user to request items. The requested items may land in a user accessible inventory or be used to restock some component. Some systems can also use item call to automatically restock, for example from Bulk Storage.
Storage tech term. Device filters shulker boxes with stackable items of the same type. Useful for set-based processing where an extra item is needed to configure an item set.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term.

Storage tech term. Usually part of a Box Sorter, a keygen is a contraption that takes one item out of a box, breaks it and sends the item and sends one through one hopper or Dropperline and the other through another one, with some delay.
Any block that a player or villager can use to produce items.

Storage tech term. Usually part of a Box Sorter, a keygen is a contraption that takes one item out of a box, breaks it and sends the item and sends one through one hopper or Dropperline and the other through another one, with some delay.
Refers to a method of entity acceleration where entities are accelerated by explosions or collisions while remaining in lazy chunks.
Tree farming term. Refers to a method of detecting tree growth by utlising the updates from leaves branching out from the bottom log when tree grows.
Refers to a method of sending signal or update through the state change of leaves.

Refers to a device that uses liquids to detect a special set of updates, some of which can be detected with a Block Update Detector, with a Comparator Update Detector or with an observer, but some of which are exclusively detected by LUDs. After detecting the update and triggering, it usually resets the liquid to a state where it can detect an update again.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term. Annotates that a signal  comes from within a Slice, not from a global system. For example, all 8 slices have their own clock.
Storage tech term.

A contraption is said to be locational when it exhibits different behavior when built in different locations in the world. This is almost always caused by redstone dust updates themselves being locational: the way they notify their neighbors of their updates is not consistent across locations in the world. It is also sometimes caused by the updates sent from removal of slime structure when pushing or pulling the structure with pistons.
Storage tech term.
Chinese: 全物品/全物品分类仓库

Description: A measurement of how many milliseconds it takes to process each gametick. If a server exceeds 50MSPT in total, then the game will slow down, as there is no longer enough time to process all 20 ticks per second. MSPT is also used as a measure of how performance-intensive a contraption is by seeing how much the MSPT increases by running/loading it.
Storage tech term. Refers to a shulker box with multiple item types.

Storage tech term. Refers to a Box Loader that can handle multiple itemtypes going to the same box. Fullness detection is usually done by reading that items are backing up in the container ( hopper / dropper ) feeding the box.
Storage tech term.

Storage tech term. Refers to a type of item sorter (system) that sorts multiple item-types into a single chest or group of chests, usually used to reduce space used by single item-type sorters to group not too common items into categories.
In huge fungus farming community, it refers to a farm with multiple tileable cores (usually n≫1) that the player travels between planting consecutively at each one
Usually refers to hopper or dropper speed in storage tech community
Refers to huge fungus.

Chinese: 网络流更新/异步线程/玩家操作更新

Spanish: Siguiente entrada (en la lista de) de Tick
Blast Chamber con Condón de Obsidiana

Description: Raid farming term. Refers to a 1.21.5+ bug, where the Bad Omen effect remains after transforming into Raid Omen, and triggering the Raid Omen effect for free every 30 seconds within the 100-minute duration of the Bad Omen effect.
Description (Chinese): 袭击术语。指一个1.21.5的漏洞，即在不祥之兆转化为袭击之兆后并没有消失，在效果持续的 100 分钟内，每 30 秒即可免费制造一次袭击之兆。

Description: Slimestone term. Usually used for bedrock breakers, which is the amount of extra space a machine requires to move down a layer. It is usually only 1 number, which means it's the same in all directions, but can be multiple instead, usually 1 for each direction. It's the number of additional blocks that must be broken around the machine's primary breaking pattern to create a hole large enough for the machine to fit.

Full Form (English): Overstacked Signal Strength (aka High Signal Strength)

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes in multiple boxes (usually single item-type boxes) and outputs pairs of boxes so that the boxes of each pair have the same item type. They differ in speed, how they handle single boxes (ones that don't have a matching pair) and implementation in general.

Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes in multiple boxes (usually single item-type boxes) and outputs pairs of boxes so that the boxes of each pair have the same item type. They differ in speed, how they handle single boxes (ones that don't have a matching pair) and implementation in general.
Storage tech term.

Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that takes in multiple boxes (usually single item-type boxes) and outputs pairs of boxes so that the boxes of each pair have the same item type. They differ in speed, how they handle single boxes (ones that don't have a matching pair) and implementation in general.

A code is said to be parallel if the all the bits of the signal are sent through individual wires or lines This usually allows for faster and easier to use codes than Serial codes, but it tends to be more expensive and bigger.

Refers to a contraption that aligns items in all three axes before sending them down a stream, where they usually get picked up by hoppers. Since these contraptions are usually ran at Hopper speed, the items need to have a perfect timing between them, so that they don't reach a hopper during its cooldown stage, hence why these are also called 4D aligners (3D+time).
When used in storage tech, it is used to describe contraptions that are almost Storage Tech. Examples are Furnace Arrays, Brewers, Crafting stations, Autocrafters, ...
A contraption using an array of pistons to move minecarts on specific rail setup to achieve a high movement speed.
Used to tag contraptions that makes no use of pistons.
Adjective. Usually to describe a contraption that does not require player existence to operate.
Usually refers to the amount of villagers in groups of 3 in an iron farm.
Description (Chinese): 通常指刷铁机内村民组（3个为一组）的数量
与中文译名相比，POI这一简称在实际讨论中似乎更常出现

Description: Storage tech term. Refers to a hopper that is unlocked in the same tick as it's supposed to suck up an item. If the item entity is created in that tick, as it would be with for example timing a shulker box breaking correctly, there will be 0 physics enacted on that item. This makes it not only extremely reliable as there are no physics issues, but also might be lazy chunk compatible [Needs proof] .
Storage tech term. Refers to a Box Loader that makes use of a Precision Hopper to achieve Slice Preservation.
Refers to filling containers with items beforehand.
Refers to blocks being placed beforehand.
Mostly used in cannons
Usually refers to a redstone signal turning on and off once.
Storage tech term.
A method or contraption that outputs when the input is push limited, usually used in tree farming community.
Chinese: 推动上限检测/推限检测/魔法检测

Description: Tree farming term. Refers to a method of detecting tree growth by QC powering the bottom log and updating a piston below the dirt, which extends when a tree grows, thus activating the farm.
Storage tech term.
A flying machine that makes trench by transporting blocks from terrain and destroys elsewhere, similar to a quarry.

The effect of quasi-powering a piston, dropper or dispenser. A good way to visualize when a block is being quasi-powering is to imagine a redstone lamp above the component. If that lamp was to be on in that location, the block is quasi-powered. Quasi-powering usually doesn't update the component being QCed, which results in the component not "realizing" it should activate or deactivate until it receives an update. For this reason, QC is often used for Block Update Detector, and people even sometimes say "BUD powered" rather than "quasi powered".
Raid farming term.
Raid farming term.
Usually refers to the speed or amount of item drops of a contraption.
Tree farming term. Refers to log being retracted downwards through the planting block (dirt or nylium) with pistons and being moved away
Usually refers to the ratio of item collected with to the actual produced item. As an example for blast chambers, it can be written as 99.6% efficiency.
Slimestone term.

Every randomized action in the game is based on a single pseudo random number generator. The generator has a reset function and a "forward function", which is called whenever a random number is required.
Manipulate the chance of a random event happening.
Litematica mod schematic
Adjective. Usually used to describe farms that produces bone meal (usually by composting excess foliage) to sustain the bone meal consumption.
Storage tech term.

A code is said to be serial if the bits of the signal are sent one after the other through a single wire. This is more space and resource efficient than Parallel codes, but usually slower and harder to implement.

In storage tech, it refers to components used to convert Serial codes into Parallel codes or viceversa. These sometimes also act as Encoders or Decoders, in the computational redstone sense. For example serial hex to parallel binary is a deserializer encoder.
Storage tech term.
Usually refers to pulling a block sideways, often used to describe bottom log processing in tree farm community.
Storage tech term.

Storage tech term. Used to tag a contraption that does not make noise when activated. Sources of noise are: pistons, uncovered note blocks, trapdoors, doors and fence gates, and droppers or dispensers failing to fire. Silent contraptions usually avoid all of those.
A repeatable (preferably tileable ) component within a system.

Storage tech term. A contraption is said to be slice preserving if it outputs the shulker boxes or items within the slice, in contrast to Global Output, where there's one output for all Slices. This term is mostly used for 1-Wide Tileable contraptions. Since some systems are only mostly slice preserving, but fail to be so in some specific condition or with a very low change, some people use the term perfect slice preservation for a system that does not have said flaws.
Adjective. Usually refers to the absence of slime ball and slime blocks of a contraption.
Flying machine related technology.
Storage tech term. A Box Display that will only break the shulker box when it's both empty and closed.
Storage tech term.
Usually referred to a piston that automatically extends when a block is placed in front of it
Description (Chinese): 一般指当面前有方块被放置就会自动伸出的活塞

Description: Used to tag a contraption that has no moving parts or, more loosely, that has no pistons spitting blocks, or other forms of Toggle state. This term is also sometimes interchangeably used with Pistonless, although you can have a solid state contraption (in the loose way) with pistons by having them never spit out the block, i.e. powering them with long pulses only.
Refers to a pile of entities, such as items or mobs
Storage tech term. Uses item entity separators to sort up to one full stack at a time.
Storage tech term. Refers to contraption that uses stack separation to filter entire stack of items at once.
Raid farming term.
Storage tech term.
Storage Technology, usually referred to item sorting and storage systems
Tree farming term. Synchronous application of bone meal to a sapling with all the dispensers, usually used to differentiate from cross bone meal
Description (Chinese): 树场群体的术语。指所有发射器同步地对树苗使用骨粉，一般用于和交叉催熟做出区分

Description: Short for Toggle Flip-Flop. Refers a circuit that changes its output state (toggles) when a pulse is received.
Storage tech term. Short for "temporary storage". Refers to a contraption that stores a partial box until another partial box with the same item type is input, after which both are output for merging

Minecraft iteratively runs its processing code in a loop. One cycle of this loop is called a Tick or Gametick (gt). Gameticks are also used as the default measurement of time while working with redstone. The game attempts to run 20 gameticks a second (20tps), but will fail to do so and slow down the game if the server is lagging (>50mspt).

A measurement of how many gameticks are happening each second. The game normally operates at 20TPS, but if MSPT exceeds 50ms then the game will start to slow down. Mods such as Carpet Mod are able to stop, slow down, or speed up the tick speed of a server, which can be useful for testing.

Full Form (English): Tile Entity Update Detector (aka Comparator Update Detector)
Description: Refers to a comparator that will change its signal once it either receives a block or inventory update. It is based on the behavior inherent to comparators where they don't notice inventory changes when reading it through a solid block (including an inventory being moved away or put in place, like a composter being moved by a piston). The CUD will then change it's signal once it either receives a block or inventory update.
Spanish: Detector de Updates de Tile Entities (Detector de Updates de Comparadores)

Description: Usually used to refer to intentionally having sticky piston's drop its block by sending it a <3gt pulse in order to cycle between two different states (toggling between block in and out). Importantly, togglestates have no default position, and there is no way to reset them. This makes them painful to use in survival as they're hard to debug. This is different to latches, which are also systems that hold state. Latches usually have a reset signal that you can trigger when something goes wrong.
A device or contraption to convert between encodings of a signal: Binary to Hexadecimal, hex to octal, pulse length to binary, block event delay to overloaded comparator, etc.
A flying machine that makes trench.
Slimestone term. Usually refers to a machine that does not require a trench while the others of the same type usually does.
Quarry which does not require clearance on the bottom or sides.

Full Form (English): Trench-less World Eater (aka 1-Wide Trench World Eater)
Description: Slimestone term. Usually refers to world eaters that only require 1 wide main trenches on both sides.
Slimestone term. Refers to machines that digs tunnels.

Tree farming term. In versions <1.17, refers to tree farm that farms all 5 types of 1x1 trees (birch, oak, spruce, jungle, acacia). In versions >1.17, usually refers to tree farm that can farm all 1x1 trees except mangrove (birch, oak, spruce, jungle, acacia, azalea, cherry).
Storage tech term. Usually refers to a contraption that unloads items from a container, such as shulker box or minecarts
Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that separates unstackable items from stackable items
Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that separates unstackable items from stackable items
Storage tech term. Refers to a contraption that sorts a certain unstackable(s) from other unstackables based on a unique property of that item
The part of a contraption or system that the end user interacts with, regardless of the inner workings of the system.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term. Refers to an item filter that does not always filter for the same item, but instead can be remapped, meaning getting the item type reassigned (in contrast with Fixed Sorter).
Storage tech term.
Slimestone term.
Spanish: Quarry de Duplicación de TNT Vertical

Description: A method that allowed players to trade infinitely by unloading a chunk where a villager is located while its trading window is open, and then making the trade while the villager isn't rendered.
Slimestone term.
Refers to a method of sending signal or update through the shape change of walls.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term.
Storage tech term. Sorts boxes by checking if it contains a specific item type in any slot
Any block that a player or villager can use to produce items.
Raid farming term.
Chinese: 可控认领/可控村民就职

Description: Usually refers to a contraption with X amount of cores, such as dual-core, tri-core etc.
X amount of game ticks.

An extension of X-Wide tileable, but where a solution has been provided by the author on how to put 2 Slices of the same system next to each other, by moving/editing some components within the system. The capital letters ( AB, or ABC, or ABCD, ... ) annotate how the slices are tiled, and how many versions of the slice exist to achieve a result.

Annotates the width of a slice, and whether or not you can build them right next to each other. There are systems that are 1 wide, but you can't put 2 next to each other due to Crosstalk, so they don't get this annotation. Sometimes they are X-Wide AB Tileable instead.
Can also be referred to as the phenomenon of collision checking along axes in entity movement based on Entity.move().
